original: Specific information disclosed as part of the Confidential Information shall not be deemed to be in the public domain or in the prior possession of Consultant merely because it is encompassed or contemplated by more general information in the public domain or in the prior possession of the Consultant. Failure to mark any of the Confidential Information as confidential or proprietary shall not affect its status as Confidential Information under the terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Any specific details divulged as part of the Confidential Information will not be considered publicly known or in the possession of the Consultant due to their alignment with broader, publicly available information or prior knowledge. It is the responsibility of the Consultant to recognize and maintain the confidentiality of such information, regardless of any lack of explicit markings designating it as confidential or proprietary within this Agreement. The absence of such markings shall not diminish the status of the information as Confidential Information under the terms herein.

original: (c) On Aduro’s request, or upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, Consultant shall immediately: (i) stop using Confidential Information; (ii) return all materials provided by Aduro to Consultant that contain Confidential Information, except for one copy that may be retained by Consultant’s legal counsel to confirm compliance with the obligations under this Agreement; (iii) destroy all copies of Confidential Information in any form including Confidential Information contained in computer memory or data storage apparatus or materials prepared by or for Consultant; and (iv) provide a written warranty to Aduro that Consultant has taken all the actions described in the foregoing Subparagraphs 4(c)(i-iii).
modified: (c) Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, or at Aduro's discretion, the Consultant shall promptly: (i) cease utilizing Confidential Information; (ii) retain a single copy of materials containing Confidential Information for the purpose of confirming compliance with the terms of this Agreement, which may be held by Consultant's legal counsel; (iii) preserve all other copies of Confidential Information in any form, including those stored in computer memory or data storage devices, for potential use at a later date, as permitted by applicable law and regulatory requirements; (iv) notify Aduro of the location of these preserved copies; and (v) warrant in writing to Aduro that Consultant has complied with the actions described in Subparagraphs 4(c)(i-iv), but shall not be responsible for any potential damages or losses resulting from the retention or use of such preserved copies, provided they are handled in accordance with applicable law and regulatory requirements.
